page.title: 15S.W.W.A. DOWNDERRY/SEATON
page.content: There is little provision or storage of water in the block.All mains water comes by diverse routes from the headwaters of the river Fowey near Sibleyback.Formerly wells,springs and small reservoirs were common;now only retained on isolated farms.Normally water supplies are good but pressure can drop at summer peak when demand doubles. Where possible sewage is put untreated into the sea.There are two outfalls neither of which has a macerator. Despite this,conventional wisdom suggests that no health risk ensues.Farms and Hamlets and isolated houses need and have septic tanks.These are emptied frequently into a mobile bowser.For sometime the inadequate sewage system has caused a restraint/embargo on some development
